title: (x) Indian Motorcycles logo - custom drawn {PD}
content:
I need help identifying the font in the attached image.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [indian120x50.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307081623/http:/typophile.com/files/indian120x50.gif) | 1.82 KB |
author: reklaw

comments.content:
I always figure these type of logos are custom - I just can't imagine you could get such a tightly fitting outcome from using a font.

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design, Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307081623/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)

Especially one from the beginning of the twentieth century  
 [http://www.photos.indianmotorbikes.com/16-24pplus/ppl009.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307081623/http:/www.photos.indianmotorbikes.com/16-24pplus/ppl009.jpg "http://www.photos.indianmotorbikes.com/16-24pplus/ppl009.jpg")

Tim

Looks like I just sent e-mail to Steve with the same opinion. I suggested looking at the [Letterhead Fonts script collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307081623/http:/letterheadfonts.com/styles/script.shtml) for something that might be similar. 'Ballpark', 'Ephemera' and 'Royal Script' are in this stylistic vein, in my opinion, if similar would work.

- Mike Yanega

Hand lettering was the most often used method in those days so I would be very surprisewd if it is type. Another current type in that style but with less garnish is Doyald Young's Homerun:

[http://www.doyaldyoung.com/111\_HR\_Script/111\_HR\_Script.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307081623/http:/www.doyaldyoung.com/111_HR_Script/111_HR_Script.html "http://www.doyaldyoung.com/111\_HR\_Script/111\_HR\_Script.html")

ChrisL

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307081623im_/http:/typophile.com/files/homerun_indian_3808.png)
They have this artwork on Brandsoftheworld.com. You can go from there to get it into the shape you want....

Actually, Letterhead Fonts has done this script:  
 [http://letterheadfonts.com/fonts/indianscript.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307081623/http:/letterheadfonts.com/fonts/indianscript.shtml "http://letterheadfonts.com/fonts/indianscript.shtml")
